page.title: 02Improving Old Coulsdon
page.content: Although the area is well catered for one or two improvements could be made. For example, the kerb from Taunton Manor School along the common could be raised to stop people parking on the grass and making it too muddy for others to walk on. A few seats could be strategically placed so that the old people could sit down and rest when they go for a walk. A small park with swings for young children could be placed by Stites Hill Road. Although Happy Valley is a large and peaceful common, horses tend to churn up the ground and after a rainfall it is knee-deep in mud. Perhaps some more picnic benches could be placed around the valley and some sturdier paths built as most paths are just mud tracks. Also a small tea room could be put by the car park near "The Fox".
